text: The biological control of pests in the garden is not new to the American gardener. Ladybirds figure in press advertisements, their sale being by the gallon. Praying mantis (Mantis religiosa), both native and "immigrant" varieties, are used by gardeners in all parts of the United States. Advertisements offer eggs of European, Chinese or native forms of mantis.
